intro: Dionysia revoluta var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf dionysia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is often cultivated in arid climates.
